newsitem.title: USA: Ex-U.S. Sen. Simon to head Croatia vote monitors.
newsitem.headline: Ex-U.S. Sen. Simon to head Croatia vote monitors.

text.p: Former U.S. Senator Paul Simon will head an Organisation for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) team to monitor presidential elections in Croatia next Sunday, the State Department said on Monday.
The 100-strong OSCE team will include 40 Americans as well as a parliamentary delegation from the organisation's 53 other members, department spokesman Nicholas Burns said.

Simon, who will be known as special coordinator for the monoitoring effort, was appointed by the chairman in office of the OSCE, Danish Foreign Minister Niels Helveg Petersen, Burns told a news briefing.
The former Democratic senator from Illinois will issue a statement on the team's findings on June 16, Burns said.
Incumbent President Franjo Tudjman is widely expected to win a clear victory in the first round of voting.
